page.title: 04BLACKRUTHVEN FARM (1)
page.content: The farm is 365 acres. It is a mixture of fruit, arable and grazing. There are 50 acres of fruit, 200 acres of barley, 20 acres of potatoes and the rest grass. There are no cattle but 300 sheep are grazed on 35 acres. No cattle were wintered this year. 12 acres of land are used for rough grazing. Blackruthven Farm is locally famous for soft fruit, growing raspberries,strawberries, gooseberries, blackcurrants, redcurrants and tayberries. The picking season last six weeks. Natural woodland covers 15 acres - beech,oak, birch and elm. Small stands of firs are planted near the house for protection. Mr. Alan Patterson, farm manager,has worked at the farm for 18 months and Blackruthven has been a family farm for 9 years.
